means: 伊师塔（巴比伦和亚述神话中司爱情、生育及战争的女神）

sentence.Network_en: ISHTAR, Queen of Night, Open Thy Gate to me!
sentence.Network_cn: 伊什塔,夜之王后, 汝之门为吾而开!

sentence.Network_en: Ishtar was abused there but released in exchange for another god.
sentence.Network_cn: 伊师塔在那里被虐待,但是以另一位神作为交换,她被释放.

sentence.Network_en: Aphrodite was originally an old - Asian goddess, similar to the Mesopotamian Ishtar and the Syro - Palestinian goddess Ashtart.
sentence.Network_cn: 阿芙罗狄蒂最初为老亚洲女神, 类似于美索不达米亚的伊师塔以及巴勒斯坦女神阿斯塔特.

means.word_mean: 1. goddess of love and fertility and war; counterpart of Ashtoreth and Astarte

auth_sentence.content: The Journal spoke recently with Mr. Grodin about making "Ishtar" and the film's checkered reputation.

auth_sentence.content: She will be borrowing eight-year-old part-bred Arab mare called Ishtar Spirit, owned by Kirsty Wiscombe.
